The surface gravity of Jupiter is about 26 newtons per kilogram. What would be the weight of a probe of mass 50 kg at Jupiter's surface?

questions.B: Tidal barrages can double as bridges
questions.C: Tidal barrages can help to prevent flooding
questions.D: Tidal barrages can alter the ecosystem around the estuary impacting on wildlife habitats

questions.question: What is the name of the renewable energy supply generated by capturing sunlight in panels that convert the sunlight into electricity?
What is the name of the renewable energy source generated from using volcanic heat found under the Earth's surface?
Which theory describes the arrangement and movement of particles in solids, liquids and gases?
In which state of matter are the particles mostly touching but arranged in a random way?
In which state of matter do the particles have the most energy?
Why can liquids not be compressed easily?
questions.A: The particles are in random arrangement
questions.C: The particles are free to move

questions.question: Why do solids have a fixed shape?
questions.A: The particles are fixed in place

questions.question: A sealed syringe contains 10 × 10<sup>-6</sup> m<sup>3</sup> of air at 1 × 10<sup>5</sup> Pa. The plunger is pushed until the volume of trapped air is 4 x 10<sup>-6</sup> m<sup>3</sup>. If there is no change in temperature what is the new pressure of the gas?
What is the relationship between the pressure and volume of a fixed mass of gas at constant temperature?
questions.A: Gas volume is directly proportional to gas pressure
questions.B: Gas volume is conversely proportional to gas pressure
questions.C: Gas volume is inversely proportional to gas pressure
questions.D: Gas volume is not proportional to gas pressure

questions.question: The pressure of a gas will _________  when the volume is decreased and will _______ when the absolute temperature is decreased.
If the absolute temperature of a gas is doubled and the pressure of the gas is halved, how will the volume change?
questions.A: It will decrease to one fourth of its original value.
questions.B: It will stay the same as its original value.
questions.C: It will increase to four times its original value.
questions.D: It will become half its original value

questions.question: If both the volume and the pressure of a gas are doubled, how will the absolute temperature change?
questions.A: It will decrease to one fourth of its original value.
questions.B: It will stay the same as its original value.
questions.C: It will increase to four times its original value.
questions.D: It will become half its original value
